DOC.HEAD: German Company Sells 33 Airliners to Midway Airlines
DOC.TEXT: Munich-based Dornier company on Wednesday announced that Midway Airlines Inc. of Chicago had signed a contract to buy 33 Dornier-328 airliners worth about $250 million. In a statement, Dornier also said Midway included in the contract an option to double the order, with delivery of the the first airliners to begin in 1993. The twin-engine, turboprop Dornier-328 is designed to carry a crew of two, with seating for up to 30 passengers. The statement said the Midway order was the largest for the West German company's new passenger plane. Dornier now has contracts to construct a total of 97 of the 328 models, the statement said.
